0.user_question: Tatiana is deciding how much of her weekend she wants to spend playing soccer. She has 7 hours on Saturday and 5 hours on Sunday. She is dividing her time between soccer, video games, and reading. If she reads for 3 hours and plays video games for 1/3 of the remaining time, what percentage of her weekend does she spend playing soccer?

ost_step.1: Tatiana has 7 (Saturday) + 5 (Sunday) = 12 hours available over both days.
ost_step.2: Reading takes up 3 hours out of those 12 hours. That leaves her with 12 - 3 = 9 hours for other activities.
ost_step.3: Video game playtime equals 1/3 * 9 = 3 hours spent gaming.
ost_step.4: With these three pastimes accounting for 3 hours each from her spare 9 hours, that means all his free time was used so none goes towards playing soccer this particular weekend.
ost_step.5: Thus we can conclude it’s impossible under current conditions for any amount or percentages pertaining to him spending 'playing soccer'. It would not apply unless either additional non-gaming activity gets factored into equation or reduction made one existing hobby duration. Otherwise no leftover idle time exists without specified use cases within prescribed framework offered herein. 0.user_question: Tatiana is deciding how much of her weekend she wants to spend playing soccer. She has 7 hours on Saturday and 5 hours on Sunday. She is dividing her time between soccer, video games, and reading. If she reads for 3 hours and plays video games for 1/3 of the remaining time, what percentage of her weekend does she spend playing soccer?

1.subquestion: Into how many parts will Tatiana divide her available time over the entire weekend if not accounted for other activities yet?

subanswer.text: Over the whole weekend (Saturday plus Sunday), Tatiana has 7 + 5 = 12 hours free. Since none of these timeshare another activity such as reading or gaming up until now, all twelve hours remain undivided. Thus she plans to split those twenty-four unallocated hours among various leisure pursuits including soccer. Answer five_particular_hourly allocation

We know he spent 3 hours reading, leaving us with \( 12 - 3 = 9 \) hours. Half of this would go to sports, thus \( \frac{9}{2} = 4.5 \) hours.

direct_answer.text:
Let's break down Tatiana's activities during the weekend hourly allocation as per your description:

Initial Time Available (in minutes):  
Saturday – Total available time: 7 hours × 60 min/hour = 420 minutes  
Sunday – Total available time: 5 hours × 60 min/hour = 300 minutes   
Total combined availability across both days: 420 + 300 = 720 minutes  
Time Spent Reading throughout Weekend: 3 hours × 60 min/hour = 180 minutes    
Remaining time after removing reading duration: 720 − 180 = 540 minutes  
Half of Remaining Non-Reading Hours Allocated To Sports: \(\frac{540}{2}\) = 270 minutes or exactly 4.5 hours

Now since you mentioned watching videos being one third (\( \frac{1}{3} \))of the rest of the remaining time besides reading & Playing Soccer together, let’s calculate Video Games Time First:  
Video Game Duration Per Day = One Third

0.user_question: Tatiana is deciding how much of her weekend she wants to spend playing soccer. She has 7 hours on Saturday and 5 hours on Sunday. She is dividing her time between soccer, video games, and reading. If she reads for 3 hours and plays video games for 1/3 of the remaining time, what percentage of her weekend does she spend playing soccer?

1.subquestion: How many hours per day does Tatiana spend doing activities other than sports (reading or gaming)?

subanswer.text: In one day, she will read for 3 hours. Let x be the number of hours spent gamming; then she would play games for 1/3x hours everyday. Since all activity times add up over both days she either reads or plays games, you get an equation like this: Day One Time + Day Two Time= Total Weekend Hours Spent Doing Activities Other Than Sports Reading+Games\overall \text{Weekend Activity} =\frac{\mathrm{Read}}{\mathrm{TotalActivity}}+\frac{X}{T}=\frac{3+(1/3)t}{(3)+(1/3)(5)}=\frac{3+(5/3)}{8}=\frac{14}{24}=0.583$Therefore she spends approximately \(0.583\) or \(58.3\% \) part of her weekend participating in non-sports related activities such as reading books and playing computer games.\(\boxed{\space}\) Answer: \(\boxed{\color{blue}{58.3}}\%\).

Note: This example uses LaTeX formatting for mathematical expressions within regular text.

direct_answer.text:
let's break down this problem. Let T represent tennis or other similar activities as well because these could include any kind of physical activity like swimming etc., not necessarily only soccer. From the question, we know that T+VG+R equals the sum of all non-active times, i.e.:
  
    T + VG + R = Total Time Available – SoccerTime
    
We also know that Tennis Activity takes up twice as much time than Video Games; hence, let’s denote TVG=Video Game Play Time. Thus our equation becomes

    T + 2TVG + R = Weekend Total Hour - SoccerHour
     
Substituting known values gives us

0.user_question: Tatiana is deciding how much of her weekend she wants to spend playing soccer. She has 7 hours on Saturday and 5 hours on Sunday. She is dividing her time between soccer, video games, and reading. If she reads for 3 hours and plays video games for 1/3 of the remaining time, what percentage of her weekend does she spend playing soccer?

1.subquestion: How many hours per day does Tatiana spend doing activities other than sports (reading or gaming)?

subanswer.text: In one day, she will read for 3 hours. Let x be the number of hours spent gamming; then she would play games for 1/3x hours everyday. Since all activity times add up over both days she either reads or plays games, you get an equation like this: Day One Time + Day Two Time= Total Weekend Hours Spent Doing Activities Other Than Sports Reading+Games\overall \text{Weekend Activity} =\frac{\mathrm{Read}}{\mathrm{TotalActivity}}+\frac{X}{T}=\frac{3+(1/3)t}{(3)+(1/3)(5)}=\frac{3+(5/3)}{8}=\frac{14}{24}=0.583$Therefore she spends approximately \(0.583\) or \(58.3\% \) part of her weekend participating in non-sports related activities such as reading books and playing computer games.\(\boxed{\space}\) Answer: \(\boxed{\color{blue}{58.3}}\%\).
